Sentencas: The impact of long-term exposure of La0.6Sr0.4CoO3 - delta to SO2-containing atmospheres was investigated.
Titulo: Degradation and regeneration of the SOFC cathode material La0.6Sr0.4CoO3-δ in SO2-containing atmospheres

Sentencas: In-situ dc-conductivity relaxation measurements showed a decrease in the chemical surface exchange coefficient of oxygen (k(chem)) during the course of 1000 h in an atmosphere with either a few ppb or 2 ppm SO2 at 700 degrees C. Post-test analyses by scanning electron microscopy with energy dispersive X-ray spectroscopy, X-ray photoelectron spectroscopy, and analytical transmission electron microscopy indicated that SrSO4 crystals with diameters of 100 nm-1 mu m are formed during the degradation, in addition to a nanocrystalline 100-300 nm thick multi-phase layer and LaCoO3 - delta at grain boundaries.
Titulo: Degradation and regeneration of the SOFC cathode material La0.6Sr0.4CoO3-δ in SO2-containing atmospheres

Sentencas: In order to regenerate the degraded sample, a thermal treatment was applied.
Titulo: Degradation and regeneration of the SOFC cathode material La0.6Sr0.4CoO3-δ in SO2-containing atmospheres

Sentencas: It could be shown that a partial re-activation of the degraded specimen takes place at 750-850 degrees C even in an atmosphere with 2 ppm SO2.
Titulo: Degradation and regeneration of the SOFC cathode material La0.6Sr0.4CoO3-δ in SO2-containing atmospheres

Sentencas: This regeneration is ascribed to the in-situ formation of catalytically active LaCoO3 - delta nanoparticles at the surface.
Titulo: Degradation and regeneration of the SOFC cathode material La0.6Sr0.4CoO3-δ in SO2-containing atmospheres

Sentencas: However, a subsequent degradation follows independently of the SO2 content of the atmosphere when the sample is kept for 1000 h at 850-900 degrees C. Post-test analyses indicate that this effect is due to a strong grain growth of the LaCoO3 - delta nanocrystals which leads to a loss in the catalytic activity.
Titulo: Degradation and regeneration of the SOFC cathode material La0.6Sr0.4CoO3-δ in SO2-containing atmospheres
Degradation and regeneration of the SOFC cathode material La0.6Sr0.4CoO3-δ in SO2-containing atmospheres
